                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • No Dependency Array: If no array is provided, useEffect runs after every render.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                useEffect(() => {
  // Code to run on component mount
}, []); // Runs once, equivalent to componentDidMount

useEffect(() => {
  // Code to run when 'count' changes
}, [count]); // Runs when 'count' changes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Cleanup Function

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Avoid Memory Leaks: Return a cleanup function from useEffect to perform cleanup operations, which is equivalent to componentWillUnmount in class components.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Use Case: Useful for removing subscriptions, canceling requests, or invalidating timers.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                useEffect(() => {
  const timer = setTimeout(() => {
    // Do something
  }, 1000);

  return () => clearTimeout(timer); // Cleanup the timer
}, []);

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Best Practices

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Separate Concerns: Use multiple useEffect hooks to separate unrelated logic.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Optimize Performance: Utilize the dependency array to prevent unnecessary re-renders and side effects.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                useEffect is a versatile hook that greatly simplifies the handling of side effects in functional components compared to class component lifecycle methods.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                This summary provides an overview of the useEffect Hook in React, explaining its purpose, basic usage, handling dependencies and cleanup, along with best practices.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Why React Hooks Make Use of Refs

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                In React, the useRef Hook is used to persist values across renders without triggering a re-render. It's a function that returns a mutable ref object whose .current property is initialized with the passed argument. The object returned from useRef will persist for the lifetime of the component.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Key Reasons for Using Refs with Hooks

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 1. Accessing DOM Elements

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Direct DOM Manipulation: Access and interact with DOM elements directly, something typically avoided in React, but necessary for certain tasks like focusing an input or integrating with third-party DOM libraries.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                const inputRef = useRef(null);
inputRef.current.focus();

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 2. Storing Mutable Values

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Persistent State: Store a mutable value that does not cause a re-render when changed. This is useful for values that you want to persist across renders but do not want to trigger updates.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                const timerId = useRef();
timerId.current = setTimeout(() => {}, 1000);

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 3. Preserving Values Between Renders

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Consistency: Maintain values between renders without causing re-renders, as opposed to state variables which cause a component to re-render when their values change.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Example: Storing the previous value of a prop or state.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                const prevCountRef = useRef();
useEffect(() => {
  prevCountRef.current = count;
});
// prevCountRef.current now holds the previous count value

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 4. Avoiding Unnecessary Renders

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Non-Reactive: Unlike state variables that cause a re-render when changed, changes to refs do not cause re-renders. This can optimize performance when you need to track values without reacting to their changes.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 5. Referencing Interval and Timeout IDs

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Managing Timers: Refs are ideal for keeping track of interval or timeout IDs that need to persist across renders but do not necessarily need to trigger updates.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                const intervalId = useRef();
intervalId.current = setInterval(() => {}, 1000);

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 6. Implementing Custom Hooks

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Custom Hook Logic: Refs can be used to implement certain functionalities in custom Hooks, like tracking the previous value of a prop or state, or managing focus behavior.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                In summary, refs provide a way to access DOM elements and store mutable data across renders without causing additional renders, making them a crucial tool in the React Hooks API for optimizing performance and managing non-reactive state.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                This summary explains the purposes and benefits of using refs in conjunction with React Hooks, highlighting their role in accessing DOM elements, storing mutable values, and preserving consistency across renders without triggering unnecessary re-renders.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Custom Hooks in React

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Custom Hooks in React are a powerful feature that allows you to extract component logic into reusable functions. A Custom Hook is a JavaScript function whose name starts with ”use” and that may call other Hooks.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Purpose of Custom Hooks

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Reusability: They enable you to reuse stateful logic between different components without changing the component hierarchy.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Simplifying Components: Custom Hooks help in keeping your components lean and focused on the UI.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Creating a Custom Hook

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Naming Convention: Custom Hooks typically start with use.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Using Other Hooks: They can utilize other Hooks like useState, useEffect, and useContext.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Example

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                function useCustomCounter(initialValue = 0) {
  const [count, setCount] = useState(initialValue);

  const increment = () => setCount(count + 1);
  const decrement = () => setCount(count - 1);

  return { count, increment, decrement };
}

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                This useCustomCounter Hook manages a counter: it initializes a count state, and provides functions to increment and decrement it.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Using Custom Hooks

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                In Functional Components: You can use custom Hooks as you would use built-in Hooks.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Sharing Logic: Custom Hooks can be shared across multiple components or even across different projects.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Example of Usage

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                function CounterComponent() {
  const { count, increment, decrement } = useCustomCounter();

  return (
    <div>
      Count: {count}
      <button onClick={increment}>Increment</button>
      <button onClick={decrement}>Decrement</button>
    </div>
  );
}

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Benefits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Modular Code: Break complex components into smaller, more manageable functions.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Shareable Logic: Share logic across components, improving consistency and reducing duplication.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Separation of Concerns: Separate the logic from the UI, making your components easier to understand and test.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Custom Hooks offer a flexible way to handle complex logic in React applications, making code more maintainable and reusable.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                This summary explains what Custom Hooks are in React, their purpose, how to create and use them, and the benefits they provide in managing stateful logic and enhancing code reusability and organization.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Strict Mode in React

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Strict Mode is a tool for highlighting potential problems in an application. It's a way to ensure your React components are following the best practices. Strict Mode does not render any visible UI, but it activates additional checks and warnings for its descendants.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Activation

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: Wrap your components with <React.StrictMode> to enable it.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Scope: Strict Mode checks are only run in development mode; they do not impact the production build.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Example

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                import React from "react";

function App() {
  return (
    <React.StrictMode>
      <MyComponent />
    </React.StrictMode>
  );
}

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Key Features

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Identifying Unsafe Lifecycles: Warns about legacy lifecycle methods that are unsafe and suggests using new lifecycle methods.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Warning About Legacy String Ref API: Encourages using callback refs instead of the old string ref API.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Detecting Unexpected Side Effects: Checks for side effects in the render phase. In Strict Mode, React intentionally double-invokes the following methods: constructor, render, shouldComponentUpdate, and getDerivedStateFromProps.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Detecting Legacy Context API Warns about the usage of the old context API, which is deprecated and likely to be removed in future versions.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Benefits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Preparing for Future Versions of React: Helps in adapting to the upcoming asynchronous rendering mode.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Improving Code Quality: Encourages writing safer and more reliable code by highlighting potential issues.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Non-Intrusive: Since it only affects development and doesn’t impact production, it’s a non-intrusive way to improve code.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Best Practices

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Use in Development: It is recommended to use Strict Mode during development to catch potential problems early.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Use in Development: It is recommended to use Strict Mode during development to catch potential problems early.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Strict Mode in React is a valuable tool for developers to ensure their code is robust, up-to-date with the latest React best practices, and ready for future updates of React.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                This summary provides an overview of React's Strict Mode, explaining its purpose, key features, and benefits, as well as how to use it to improve the quality and future-proofing of React applications.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # Different Ways to Style a React Component

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Styling in React can be approached in various ways, each with its own advantages and use cases. Here are some of the popular methods:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 1. Inline Styling

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: Directly within component's render method using the style attribute.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Example:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                const style = { color: "blue", fontSize: "12px" };
return <div style={style}>Hello World</div>;

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Pros: Quick and easy for simple styles.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Cons: Not suitable for complex styles; lacks features like pseudo-classes and media queries.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 2. CSS Stylesheets

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: Traditional CSS files linked in your React components.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Example:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                import "./App.css";
return <div className='app'>Hello World</div>;

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 3. CSS Modules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: Locally scoped CSS styles that can be imported into components.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Example:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                import styles from "./App.module.css";
return <div className={styles.app}>Hello World</div>;
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Pros: Local scope prevents naming conflicts.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Cons: Requires build configuration (Webpack, etc.).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 4. Styled-components

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: Library that utilizes tagged template literals to write actual CSS in JavaScript.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Example:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                import styled from "styled-components";
const StyledDiv = styled.div`
  color: blue;
  font-size: 12px;
`;
return <StyledDiv>Hello World</StyledDiv>;

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Pros: Scoped to components, supports dynamic styling.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Cons: Might be less intuitive for developers not familiar with template literals.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                # 5. CSS-in-JS

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Usage: JavaScript libraries that allow CSS to be written within JavaScript files.
